intro: Eulophidium, commonly known as the common green alga, is a genus of freshwater green algae belonging to the order Sphaeropleales. These organisms are characterized by their unicellular structure and the presence of chloroplasts containing chlorophyll a and b, typical of green algae. They often form dense colonies that can be found in ponds, lakes, and other freshwater habitats. Eulophidium species are important in aquatic ecosystems as primary producers and serve as a food source for various aquatic organisms. Their rapid growth and ability to thrive in a wide range of environmental conditions make them ecologically significant.
